python.name: Python
python.readme_template:
# Python Project

## Description
A Python project.

## Installation
```bash
pip install -r requirements.txt
```

## Usage
```bash
python main.py
```

## Virtual Environment
```bash
python -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate  # On Windows: venv\Scripts\activate
pip install -r requirements.txt
```

# Android Project

## Description
An Android application project.

## Requirements
- Android Studio
- Android SDK
- Java/Kotlin

## Setup
1. Open the project in Android Studio
2. Sync Gradle files
3. Run the application

## Build
```bash
./gradlew assembleDebug
```

laravel.name: Laravel
laravel.readme_template:
# Laravel Project

## Description
A Laravel PHP framework application.

## Requirements
- PHP >= 8.1
- Composer
- MySQL/PostgreSQL
- Node.js & NPM (for frontend assets)

## Installation
```bash
# Clone the repository
git clone [repository-url]
cd [project-name]

# Install dependencies
composer install
npm install

# Environment setup
cp .env.example .env
php artisan key:generate

# Database setup
php artisan migrate
php artisan db:seed
```

## Usage
```bash
# Start development server
php artisan serve

# Compile assets
npm run dev
# or for production
npm run build
```

## Testing
```bash
php artisan test
```

flutter.name: Flutter
gitignore: # Android Studio will place build artifacts here
flutter.readme_template:
# Flutter Project

## Description
A Flutter mobile application.

## Requirements
- Flutter SDK
- Dart SDK
- Android Studio / VS Code
- Android SDK (for Android development)
- Xcode (for iOS development, macOS only)

## Getting Started
```bash
# Get Flutter dependencies
flutter pub get

# Run the app
flutter run

# For specific platform
flutter run -d android
flutter run -d ios
```

## Build
```bash
# Build APK (Android)
flutter build apk

# Build iOS (macOS only)
flutter build ios

# Build for web
flutter build web
```

## Testing
```bash
# Run tests
flutter test

# Run integration tests
flutter drive --target=test_driver/app.dart
```

## Project Structure
- `lib/` - Main Dart code
- `test/` - Unit and widget tests
- `android/` - Android-specific code
- `ios/` - iOS-specific code
- `web/` - Web-specific code
